org.pcc.pams.objects

Class Wall

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pcc.pams.objects.PhysicsObject
      • org.pcc.pams.objects.Wall

  • public class Wall
extends PhysicsObject
    Represents a static wall. The wall is defined by two objects: a rectangle, which describes its appearance, and an infinite line, which be horizontal or vertical, which represents the boundary for the wall.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.Color baseColor
      The wall's base color, from which its current color is calculated.
      private Vector2d boundsLine
      A point of the infinite boundary line's position.
      private double collisionIntensity
      The wall's current level of collision.
      private Vector2d dimensions
      The wall's drawable dimensions.
      static double INTENSITY_DEC
      The collision intensity decrementing unit.
      static double INTENSITY_INC
      The collision intensity incrementing unit.
      private boolean isHorizontal
      Whether the wall is horizontal or vertical.

      • Fields inherited from class org.pcc.pams.objects.PhysicsObject

        position, speed

      Constructor and Description

      Constructs a new static wall.

    • Field Detail

      • INTENSITY_INC

        public static final double INTENSITY_INC
        The collision intensity incrementing unit.

        Raise this to make the intensity rise faster.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INTENSITY_DEC

        public static final double INTENSITY_DEC
        The collision intensity decrementing unit. Lower this to make the intensity diminish faster.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • dimensions

        private final Vector2d dimensions
        The wall's drawable dimensions.

      • boundsLine

        private final Vector2d boundsLine
        A point of the infinite boundary line's position. Used to calculate collisions.

      • baseColor

        private final java.awt.Color baseColor
        The wall's base color, from which its current color is calculated. The wall's color depends on its collisionIntensity.

      • isHorizontal

        private final boolean isHorizontal
        Whether the wall is horizontal or vertical.

      • collisionIntensity

        private double collisionIntensity
        The wall's current level of collision. This represents how recently and how intensely the wall has been collided with, and is used to modify its color.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wall

        public Wall(Vector2d dimensions,
            Vector2d position,
            boolean isHorizontal,
            double boundsOffset,
            java.awt.Color baseColor)
        Constructs a new static wall.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - The width and height of the wall's representation.
        position - The position of the top-left corner of the wall.
        isHorizontal - Whether the wall is horizontal or vertical.
        boundsOffset - The distance along one coordinate between the wall's position and its bounds.
        baseColor - The wall's base color.

    • Method Detail

      • getDimensions

        public Vector2d getDimensions()
        Returns the size of the wall's representation.
        Returns:
        The wall's dimensions.

      • isHorizontal

        public boolean isHorizontal()
        Returns whether the wall is oriented horizontally or vertically.
        Returns:
        True if horizontal, false if vertical.

      • getBoundsLine

        public Vector2d getBoundsLine()
        Returns the position of the bounds line. This is the line that needs to be tested against for collisions.
        Returns:
        The bounds line's position.

      • adjustCollisionIntensity

        public void adjustCollisionIntensity(double delta)

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Calculates and returns the color of the wall. The color depends on the current collision intensity, which increases when a ball hits and decreases over time.
        Returns:
        The wall's current color.
